inclusion.criterion: Indigenous T'boli patient aged 18 years old and above, male or female
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Patients with clinically diagnosed tinea imbricata with microscopically confirmed skin
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: quote: Tinea pedis infection confirmed as his diagnosis by the observation of segmented fungal hyphae during a microscopic KOH wet mount examination.

inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: quote: Tinea pedis infection confirmed as his diagnosis by the observation of segmented fungal hyphae during a microscopic KOH wet mount examination.

exclusion.criterion: Patients who were treated or undergoing treatment with topical anti-fungal for 2 weeks
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: or oral anti-fungal 1 month before the study
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Patients who were taking other systemic medications such as cytotoxic and immunosuppressive drugs
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Patients with known liver disease, kidney dysfunction, hematologic problems (e.g. anemia)
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Patients with or suspected allergy to Senna alata extract
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: 41 year old male patient with tinea pedis infection, no history of underlying disease, normal physical exam and lab studies.
